title: Oceanic Challenger Series roster trials for Lynx

embed.description: This proves that you have dedicated enough time to the game to achieve this rank and can show the same determination to improving your competitive gameplay.

body:
Hey, guys, Lynx will be running its trials for the Oceanic Challenger Series in December of 2017. 
We are after some existing talent as well as some new and upcoming talent.
We do however have a cutoff rank so please do check that out.

We have taken into consideration Uni exams and pushed our trials till the end of the year to allow players to prepare themselves for this application.
Follow us to keep updated with information
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lynx_gg)
[Application](http://lynx.gg/articles/news/gaming/10/trials-for-2018-split-1)
[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lynxg/)

replies.body:
Someone told me they got to challenger in under 500 games from their first game. So that means that anyone with over 500 games has proven themselves to be dedicated enough to apply for your team, according to your own logic.
 
Since I have over 500 ranked games on a single champion this season alone, add me and keep me posted on when the trials are so i can be ready, thanks.
If you are so frustrated by how teams are recruiting using a cutoff rank, you should make your own team and prove to us by winning rather than posting in all these threads mate. Calm your farm.

The problem goes both ways, the only way to get players who have good enough mechanics and enough confidence to execute the strats I want are the diamond/master/challenger players, it is just that my account is a statistical anomaly, and that is what I am trying to make people realise so that I can either recruit players who are good enough to execute the strats, or join a team who is good enough not to just lose against everyone higher rank than them.

Okay MR PUMA!

Here is what I am going to tell you is probably the best piece of advice anyone is going to give you, so listen well.

You are shit! If you feel offended by that statement then you are not ready for pro play! Pro play is about criticism, pro play is about not being happy with your performance! Pro play is about doing whatever you can to be the best!

If you well and truly acknowledge the statement then it will be the road to your salvation! 
http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=Whitepumah

Now I will tell you what you have to do if you want to be a pro player if not I will still leave this up here for people who actually want to become a pro!

Step One!
First and foremost pick a flipping role! You have played 64 different champions I have no clue what you main but I can assume you play ADC since well you got 600 games on twitch!
A pro player will only play the champions in his role or if need be the complementary to his role but will dodge if auto-filled into anything else. Some contracts require that too!
For an ADC main they must pick primary for Marksman and Secondary as Support! As the knowledge base for both the roles can be correlated to each other. Plus both the roles start the game in bot lane and lane until laning is over so, therefore, having an understanding of the bottom lane would be beneficial
Stop playing flipping JUNGLE AND TOP LANE!

Step Two!
Evenly distribute your games across all marksman type champions. Each champion brings about a different type of gameplay and understanding to a game! You have had way too many games on twitch and not so much on the others so your understanding is equivalent to one trick! That means you base your strategy off the champion you play the most! in this case, it would be twitch!

PS! One tricks don't work in competitive gameplay as your twitch will be banned against you every game! And you may think Ow I still have other champions I can play well the answer to that is yes you do but you will still lose! Since you have no recollection of how to play a losing matchup with someone like Lucian since you only have had 1 game on him! And died 12 times. 

Pro players don't play more than one champion just for the fun of it. They do it to understand how lanning phase works into unfavourable and favourable match ups! So they can learn to abuse their laners and their weakness in a role reversal matchup!

Step Three!
Watch your replays! If you can go through your own replays and watch where you died and pinpoint what you did that lead to that death and how you can avoid it in the near future! That will gain you the ability of an average improving player! If you can pinpoint your deaths and what you could have done instead to take down the enemy nexus without any casualties then you are on your way to pro play!

Step Four!
Watch competitive gameplay! If you don't watch competitive gameplay and understand why each team is making the decisions they are then you my friend dont deserve to even be considered by any team. Competitive League of Legends and solo queue for ranked are two distinctly different games! If you cant accept this fact then that is further proof of not being ready for pro play!

Step Five!
Get a higher rank! You may not want to hear this but players in Challenger have also put in multiple hours into champions and the game to get that rank! They have the same dedication and determination as you so why should they be overlooked for your gold rank! You are nothing special! In order to stand out, you need to be at the very top of the game! So make it your mission to become the best otherwise the pro play thing that you keep asking everyone to give you a shot as well just be a distant fantasy!

Follow these guidelines and in no time you will be part of a team! But at the end of the day it is only up to you to make yourself better! If you are not ready to accept and change the way you see things! well then all of this is a waste and you may never get what you want!

Wow, another person who preaches the word of Riot's bible.

Sorry but I am into science and maths. so personally, being told I am shit has absolutely no value to me so I can't be offended by it. 

Feel free to preach your words to others but make sure you are aware of the other possibility. https://ethicalnag.org/2009/10/26/tooth-fairy-science/ 

"You can get reliable data that are reproducible, consistent, and statistically significant. You think you have learned something about the Tooth Fairy. But you haven’t. Your data has another explanation, parental behaviour, that you haven’t even considered. You have deceived yourself by trying to do research on something that doesn’t exist.”

What are you on about man? You can only hold a non-biased opinion if you have taken up both paths. Whats this tooth fairy stuff have to do with anything. 

You are literally saying I want things to be done my way and I want to be a pro. SO the world will have to change to suit me and give me the opportunity to do so. That's the most arrogant thing I have heard anyone say.

Like the methodology I just described above to you has been done and proven by many players some of which originated in bronze. A lot lower rank than you are currently are sitting at.

Like if you want to be a doctor, you have to get a degree, a medical certificate and have practiced under supervision in real operations. You don't just rock up to a hospital and say I understand how the human body works, now make me a doctor so I can prove it.

Same with athletes. Unless you haven't realised pro players are athletes. They practice several hours to a day to hone their muscle memory and better their decision making against other high calibre players. To simply want to play with pro - semi pro players cause you think you have a unique strategy that players of your rank cant execute is blatantly delusional. 

There is no special treatment to anyone! You want a spot to trial in a pro team you have to work hard to gain that role and their attention. They don't just set goals so anyone could join, only the most dedicated and determined person that won't let anything stop them can be there. 

And news flash, that's why they are challenger! So get your act together or don't bother doing pitty post and acting all high and mighty thinking your above everyone to get a position to trial. If anything I should get a trial in a pro team over you. I grind so many hours looking at pro play and analysing my game to improve. Heck, I was even diamond 1 two seasons ago. I still remember how hard I worked for that. 

SO yea back of the line buddy.

Don’t think they accept gold V if you read their thing

I think he is trying to point out that they are implying that the result they are after is the determination and dedication, so he is trying to provide them with an understanding that he has already proven himself in a different way other than achieving the rank they have set.
Why not just start your own OOL team? Would be easier than trying to get accepted by the team that you don't meet their criteria.

It also says "willing to learn & improve" which you're clearly incapable of based on your post history on the boards and you're legitimately hard stuck in Gold 5, not trying to flame or degrade your skill so don't take it as a personal attack but more of an observation, just that if someone was actively learning and improving they would climb over such a large number of games rather than be stagnant. You also seem to only be able to play Twitch (my fav champ too btw xD ) in the adc role since that is the only one with a positive win rate and its 500 of your 600games played, one tricks are usually banned out for obvious reasons. From the information any reasonable person can gather from your account history both in-game and on the boards it would be clear you're more of a liability than an asset. 
But you can always reform! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
7 Days till we start our trials for OCS 2018
